alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Eastern Lincoln County; Guadalupe County; Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 26 at 2:32PM MST until February 27 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM MST MONDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 5 PM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, west winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 70 mph. For the Wind Advisory, west winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...Central Highlands, Eastern Lincoln County, Guadalupe County, East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains, and Northeast Highlands. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, until 1 AM MST Monday. For the Wind Advisory, from 1 AM to 5 PM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Power outages are possible. Damage may occur to mobile homes, roofs, sheds, barns, outbuildings, and fences. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Areas of blowing dust will create reduced visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A brief period of blowing snow creating reduced visibility is possible in the Central Highlands and the east slopes of the Sangre de Cristo Mountains this afternoon.
info.instruction: Take action to secure trash cans, lawn furniture, and other loose or lightweight outdoor objects. Extremely hazardous driving conditions can be expected, especially for motorists in high profile vehicles who should consider delaying travel.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Eastern Lincoln County; Guadalupe County; Northeast Highlands
